instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 00840 shutting down
threads.message: this one came, with a very weird issue...it would turn on, then after a minute or so, would freeze and keeps the cpu heating up, while no video or usb activity meaning braindead...after that i took the board out of the case, and found C7701  knocked down, so i replaced it. i put everything back together and then i noticed that now, it would turn on, i can click on the trackpad, but soon after shutdown outta nowhere, i cant click. dunno where to start on this one...

threads.title: 820 00840 shutting down
threads.message:
Did you test the board outside?
Use USB-C hub for HDMI output and USB macOS for test.
Checfor other knocked off components.
Do you get all voltages, including VCORE?

threads.title: 820 00840 shutting down
threads.message:
yes board tested outside, same result.

i checked no video anywhere.

i throughly checked the board but i cant find anything else...

when its on, i get all voltages, but since shuts down after a few seconds...

threads.title: 820 00840 shutting down
threads.message:
well, i put it outta the case, and it turned on. booted to osx, and get a kernel panic -spinlock acquisition timed out-, after that it shut down with a black screen...so i guess this is a RAM issue?, or what else can cause this?

if its ram, its worth fixing? where would i get the ram chips for this? or the stencil? i got some spare boards that i could take them off...i mean i think they are underfilled and they cant be reflowed to test at least...

threads.title: 820 00840 shutting down
threads.message: Could be RAM, but also CPU issue; is pretty hopeless...

threads.title: 820 00840 shutting down
threads.message: So this is trash?, or should I try to replace/recall the ram?

threads.title: 820 00840 shutting down
threads.message:
If you have time and good tools, try RAM.
You can gain experience, at least...
